gameCore

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • gameCore.LayoutObject
        • gameCore.Tile

  • public class Tile
extends LayoutObject
    A Tile is the minimal unit in the game. They have a location and edges. It can contain items (in the form of an inventory) and a character. A Tile can look at adjacent tiles, but no farther (relative to the public API anyways).
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Group D, Main author: Darrell Penner Group D Members --------------- Karen Madore Trang Pham Darrell Penner

    • Method Detail

      • getInventory

        public Inventory getInventory()
        Gets the items on the current tile.
        Returns:
        The inventory on the tile

      • getInventory

        public Inventory getInventory(Direction direction)
        Gets the items on the adjacent tile in the given direction. The character must be able to move to the tile in that direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to look in.
        Returns:
        The inventory on the adjacent tile
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the character on this tile cannot move to the tile in the given direction

      • getCharacter

        public Character getCharacter()
        Gets the character on this tile.
        Returns:
        The character if one exists, null otherwise

      • getCharacter

        public Character getCharacter(Direction direction)
        Gets the character on the adjacent tile in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to search for
        Returns:
        the Character on the adjacent tile, null if none exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the character on this tile cannot cross the edge in the given direction

      • getLocation

        public java.awt.Point getLocation()
        Gets the location of the tile.

        Returns:
        The string representation of the needed key.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is no Exit in the given direction.

      • isCrossable

        public boolean isCrossable(Direction direction)
        Checks whether the edge in the given direction is crossable by the character in the tile
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction of desired crossing
        Returns:
        True if the edge is crossable, false otherwise

      • canMove

        public boolean canMove(Direction direction)
        Checks if the character on this tile can move in the given direction. Movement is possible if the edge in between is crossable, and there is no character on the destination tile.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction of possible movement.
        Returns:
        True if movement is possible in the given direction, false otherwise.

      • moveCharacter

        public Tile moveCharacter(Direction direction)
        Moves the character to the tile in the given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction to move the player
        Returns:
        The new tile of the character
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the player cannot move in the given direction. Try calling canMove(direction) first.

      • hasCharacter

        public boolean hasCharacter()
        Checks if the tile has a Character on it
        Returns:
        True if the tile has a character, false otherwise

      • hasCharacter

        public boolean hasCharacter(Direction direction)
        Checks if the adjacent tile in the given direction has a Character
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction in which to check for a character
        Returns:
        True if the adjacent Tile has a Character, false otherwise

      • hasItems

        public boolean hasItems()
        Checks if the tile has any items
        Returns:
        True if the tile has items, false otherwise.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the tile is empty. A tile is considered empty if it has no Items an on Character
        Returns:
        True if the tile is empty, false otherwise

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty(Direction direction)
        Checks if the adjacent tile is empty. A tile is considered empty if it has no Items and no Character
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction in which to check
        Returns:
        True if the adjacent tile is empty, false otherwise
        Throws:
        if - there is no Tile in that direction

      • hasExit

        public boolean hasExit(Direction direction)
        Checks whether there is an Exit in a given the direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - The direction in which to check.
        Returns:
        True if there is an Exit, false otherwise.

        Returns:

        Parameters:
